sentence.idiomatic: My family has run into a difficulty, I have to go back immediately.
The computer was just repaired and there's something wrong with it again.
What's going on outside?
Please warm this food up for me.
Please don't heat it, I like to drink it cold.
How long do I need to heat this up for?
The washing machine is still spinning, you shouldn't open it.
The machine has stopped spinning already.
Look, now the wheel is rotating very quickly.
My car has something wrong with it, I need to take it to get repaired.
This computer is too old, there's no point fixing it.
Did you get your wristwatch fixed?
If you buy more you can have a twenty percent discount; it's a really good value.
It's not worth it to go so far to drink one cup of coffee.
Is buying or renting a house more worthwhile?
This air conditioner is too old, we won't recycle it.
They frequently recycle old mobile phones; they refurbish them a little and then sell them to other people.
Where can one recycle old furniture?
TV, refrigerator, washing machine repair. TV, refrigerator, washing machine repair.
Can you fix a microwave?
Yes, what is the problem?
It doesn't heat very well. I used to be able to microwave something in two minutes, now even after twenty minutes it's not hot.
How long ago did you buy it?
Almost 10 years ago.
Wow, that is old. You should buy a new one.
You can't fix it?
It's not worth it.
Oh, do you recycle?
Yes, but 40 RMB is the most I'd pay you.
Huh? That's not very much.
That's the price everywhere.

word.literal: to not be able to repair
